Question
========

It examines how many people would answer yes when asked whether they ever feel depressed. The percentage who answer with "yes. answers is 30% from a sample of 350 randomly asked people. The researchers want to know if the percentage is greater than 25%. To that end they set the null hypothesis at H~0~: *p*~0~ = 25%. From what percentage can the null hypothesis be rejected when a significance level is used of 2.5%?

Answerlist
----------

* 25%
* 30%
* 35%

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 25%: Incorrect
* 30%: Correct
* 35%: Incorrect
